snippet: The government now backs about 90 percent of new home mortgages. A new report outlines a plan for getting the private sector more involved.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column explores report by Bipartisan Policy Center panel outlining a plan for rejuvenating the role of the private sector in the American mortgage market; notes that the government now backs about 90 percent of new home mortgages.
lead_paragraph: The government now backs about 90 percent of new home mortgages. A new report outlines a plan for getting the private sector more involved.

headline.print_headline: Easing U.S., Slowly, Out of Home Financing
headline.seo: Report Lays Out Plan to Reduce Government Role in Home Financing
headline.main: Easing U.S., Slowly, Out of Home Financing
